properties.title: Departure Den Helder
properties.summary: The K-XVIII departed on 14 November 1934 from the Dutch Navy harbor in Den Helder to commence the longest solo mission for a submarine. On board the K-XVIII was professor Vening Meinesz.

properties.title: Founder of NWO
properties.summary: Vening Meinesz was one of the founders of NWO. Thanks to his international network and experiences, the professor saw the possibilities of governmental funding in the scientific world.

properties.title: Gravity Explained
properties.summary: The goal of Vening Meinesz was to measure the gravity field of the Earth. What is gravity and why does it differ on various locations.

properties.title: Aboard K-XVIII
properties.summary: The crewmembers on board the K-XVIII had to live in a cramped submarine for eight months. This meant they had to adjust to each other and the circumstances.

properties.title: Isostasy Explained
properties.summary: Vening Meinesz discovered, during his many expeditions that the strength of the crust is partially responsible for supporting mountains and continents.

properties.title: Crossing of the Snip
properties.summary: One of the objectives of the K-XVIII was to be a navigational beacon for KLM’s first trans-continental postal flight.	Thanks to the K-XVIII it could safely cross the Atlantic Ocean.

properties.title: Plate Tectonics
properties.summary: The theory of plate tectonics was not yet accepted by the academic society during Vening Meinesz time. He did not believe in it, but his observations tell a different story.

properties.title: Neptune's Ritual
properties.summary: Crossing the equator with a ship could attract the god of the ocean to come aboard. Neptune and his wife visited the K-XVIII, when they crossed the equator on the 11th of January 1935.

properties.title: Romanche Trench
properties.summary: The Romanche Trench is more than seven km deep and located between Africa and South America. The trench is formed, where two plates move along each other, constructing a transform fault.

properties.title: Waving the Flag
properties.summary: During this time the reputation of the Dutch Navy was very low among the Dutch citizens. The Navy used this expedition to improve this reputation in the Netherlands.

properties.title: Biography Vening Meinesz
properties.summary: Professor Vening Meinesz has achieved a lot during his life. His dedication to science played a major role in his life and he has influenced many scientists throughout the world.

properties.title: K-XVIII submarine
properties.summary: Thanks to an incredible design and engineering of the K-XVIII, this vessel was able to sail the Earth’s oceans and complete a trip of 23,000 miles.

properties.title: Diving Procedure
properties.summary: The crewmembers aboard the K-XVIII performed diving procedures three times a day, on average. These procedures were performed by at least one third of the crew.

properties.title: Spreading Ridge
properties.summary: The spreading ridge is an important aspect in plate tectonics. Vening Meinesz measured the gravity effect of several of these ridges during the voyage with the K-XVIII.

properties.title: Tristan da Cunha
properties.summary: Tristan da Cunha is a volcanic island situated in the middle of the South Atlantic Ocean. On the island is a British settlement, which is one of the most remote places to live.

properties.title: Hotspot Volcanism
properties.summary: Hotspot volcanism is one of the three types of volcanism found on Earth. The source for these volcanoes is found in the deep layers of the mantle.

properties.title: Gravity compared
properties.summary: The incredible work is best shown when we compare the gravity observations of Vening Meinesz with current satellite data. Thanks to the incredible accurate observations of Vening Meinesz, numerous secrets of the Earth were discovered.

properties.title: Stay at Cape Town
properties.summary: After a long and stormy stretch over the South Atlantic Ocean, the K-XVIII finally arrived in Cape Town. The crew and the professor were greatly welcomed.

properties.title: Pendulum Apparatus
properties.summary: Vening Meinesz had designed the pendulum apparatus in 1921 to remove vertical motions from the observations. This invention made it possible to observe the gravity field on the oceans.

properties.title: Calibration and Time
properties.summary: The cause of his precise measurements of the gravity field is the numerous calibrations Vening Meinesz performed in the years before his expeditions.

properties.title: Depth Measurements
properties.summary: The K-XVIII had sonar equipment on board for measuring the depth of the ocean floor, essential for Vening Meinesz’ studies. They revealed many secrets of the deep oceans.

properties.title: Comité "Onze Marine"
properties.summary: The citizens of the Netherlands were excited by the long voyage of the K-XVIII. They started a comity to help the crew during the entire expedition.

properties.title: Troubles Onboard
properties.summary: In contrast with the reports from the movie and media, the mood onboard the K-XVIII wasn’t always excellent. There were some arguments between the professor and the captain.

properties.title: Location Finding
properties.summary: To determine the position of the K-XVIII, the navigation officer would use a sextant to measure different angles between celestial objects.

properties.title: Geoid Explained
properties.summary: Geodesy is the study that is responsible for measuring the shape of the Earth. One of their biggest concerns is the definition of 0 meter height, or sea level.

properties.title: Stay at Fremantle
properties.summary: Many Australians came to see the K-XVIII when it arrived in Fremantle. The professor visited the University of West Australia, where he made an observation of the gravity field.

properties.title: Holweck-Lejay
properties.summary: The Golden Calf was too big and heavy to quickly take on land, so Vening Meinesz had acquired a Holweck-Lejay gravimeter from the “Bataafsche Petrolium Maatschappij” to perform land measurements.

properties.title: Chronometers
properties.summary: Professor Vening Meinesz needed accurate timekeeping during his voyage for his precise gravity measurements, so he brought the best clocks available with him.

properties.title: Subduction Zone
properties.summary: At the end of the journey of the K-XVIII they sailed over a subduction zone, which is, coincidentally, also the location of the end-of-life of an oceanic plate.

properties.title: Reception at Surabaya
properties.summary: After eight months of sailing the oceans of the Earth, the K-XVIII with professor Vening Meinesz arrived at the final port, Surabaya, where a large crowd awaited them.

properties.title: Evolution of the Gravimeter
properties.summary: TBD
